content:
hl7-fhircast-bot opened Issue #198

## May 2019 Ballot Comment:

Submitted by Anthony Julian
Chapter/section: Intent Verification Request
Url: https://fhircast.hl7.org/specification/May2019Ballot/index.html
Type: NEG :exclamation: Clarification
In Person requested: Yes :bust_in_silhouette:

Summary:

Comment: See note on ANSI modal Verbs

Existing wording: Subscribers must renew their subscription before the lease seconds period is over to avoid interruption.
Proposed wording: Subscribers SHALL renew their subscription before the lease seconds period is over to avoid interruption.

_This issue was imported by @hl7-fhircast-bot from the consolidated FHIRcast May 2019 ballot spreadsheet._

hl7-fhircast-bot edited Issue #198

## May 2019 Ballot Comment:

Submitted by Anthony Julian
Chapter/section: Intent Verification Request
Url: https://fhircast.hl7.org/specification/May2019Ballot/index.html
Type: NEG :exclamation: Clarification
In Person requested: Yes :bust_in_silhouette:

Summary:

Comment: See note on ANSI modal Verbs

Existing wording: Subscribers must renew their subscription before the lease seconds period is over to avoid interruption.
Proposed wording: Subscribers SHALL renew their subscription before the lease seconds period is over to avoid interruption.

_This issue was imported by @hl7-fhircast-bot from the consolidated FHIRcast May 2019 ballot spreadsheet._

isaacvetter commented on Issue #198

NOTE on ANSI modal verbs: The usage of ANSI modal verbs consistently provides a vehicle for quickly discerning the conformance criteria.
HL7 adheres to ISO/IEC directive, Appendix G: ANSI modal verbs ("SHALL", "SHOULD", "MAY", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD NOT", "MAY NOT") SHALL be capitalized. See FHIR conformance rules, section 2.1.0.1 "Conformance Language". http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/conformance-rules.html

isaacvetter commented on Issue #198

Tony,

This isn't intended to be a mandatory statement, rather a statement of fact. The required behavior is that the Hub must no send notifications to a subscriber once lease_seconds has expired.

Existing Wording:

The Hub-determined number of seconds that the subscription will stay active before expiring, measured from the time the verification request was made from the Hub to the subscriber. Subscribers must renew their subscription before the lease seconds period is over to avoid interruption.

Proposed wording:

The Hub-determined number of seconds that the subscription will stay active before expiring, measured from the time the verification request was made from the Hub to the subscriber. If provided to the client, the Hub SHALL unsubscribe the client once lease_seconds has expired. Subscribers must renew their subscription before the lease seconds period is over to avoid interruption.

isaacvetter edited a comment on Issue #198

Tony,

This isn't intended to be a mandatory statement, rather a statement of fact. The required behavior is that the Hub must no send notifications to a subscriber once lease_seconds has expired.

How about:

Existing Wording:

The Hub-determined number of seconds that the subscription will stay active before expiring, measured from the time the verification request was made from the Hub to the subscriber. Subscribers must renew their subscription before the lease seconds period is over to avoid interruption.

Proposed wording:

The Hub-determined number of seconds that the subscription will stay active before expiring, measured from the time the verification request was made from the Hub to the subscriber. If provided to the client, the Hub SHALL unsubscribe the client once lease_seconds has expired. Subscribers must renew their subscription before the lease seconds period is over to avoid interruption.

isaacvetter commented on Issue #198

Tony responded over zulip with this alternative proposed wording:

Proposed wording: >The Hub-determined number of seconds that the subscription will stay active before expiring, measured from the time the verification request was made from the Hub to the subscriber. If provided to the client, the Hub SHALL unsubscribe the client once lease_seconds has expired. Subscribers must renew their subscription before the lease seconds period is over to avoid interruption.

isaacvetter deleted a comment on Issue #198

Tony responded over zulip with this alternative proposed wording:

Proposed wording: >The Hub-determined number of seconds that the subscription will stay active before expiring, measured from the time the verification request was made from the Hub to the subscriber. If provided to the client, the Hub SHALL unsubscribe the client once lease_seconds has expired. Subscribers must renew their subscription before the lease seconds period is over to avoid interruption.

isaacvetter commented on Issue #198

Per zulip conversation, my current proposed paragraph is:

Proposed wording: The Hub-determined number of seconds that the subscription will stay active before expiring, measured from the time the verification request was made from the Hub to the subscriber. If provided to the client, the Hub SHALL unsubscribe the client once lease_seconds has expired. If the subscriber wishes to continue the subscription it MAY resubscribe.

wmaethner labeled Issue #198
